results.title: Hector's roadshow
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Humour and fantasy are employed to convey an essential road safety message to young children. Kerb drill, bicycle safety and the use of seat belts are emphasized in this zany pantomine. Cast: Tony Strachan and Greg Temple. Cinematographer/Director of Photography: Edwin Scragg.

results.title: Heavy petting
results.brief_description: Using footage from Hollywood in the 50’s and 60’s and educational material from the era, known personalities reflect on what it was like to be a living, breathing, sexual being in the 1950’s or 60’s. People such as Allan Ginsberg, William Burroughs, Sandra Bernhard, Francis Fisher, Frederic Lahey, John Oates and Zoe Tamerlaine discuss issues such as; dating, masturbation, petting, falling in love, menstruation, things you did to look cool, cruising, parties, dances, teen pregnancy, STD, and all the other concerns surrounding being a teenager. Set to a soundtrack of music from the decades in question, this snappy and entertaining documentary presents the viewer with a slice of 50’s and 60’s nostalgia.

results.title: Heavy horse pull
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Beryl Fox, Don Hopkins, Ronald Squire and Roberta King
results.brief_description: A humorous documentary about horse-pulling contests in Ontario and the people who prepare for them, this film tackles heavy loads with a light touch. It travels from the farm to the contest, where excitement runs high and the quips do not lack in local colour. Photographed by Robert Fresco.

results.title: Heatwave
results.creator_credit: Heatwave Films Pty Ltd, Sydney Australia F F P A A, Hilary Linstead, Ross Matthews and Phil Noyce
results.brief_description: A suspenseful thriller about a woman who cared too much about people, their lives and their homes, and a man who had a job to do and wouldn’t be swayed by emotions. She represented the people, he represented power and corruption and together they were heading towards trouble. Cast includes Judy Davis, Richard Moir, Chris Haywood, Bill Hunter and John Meillon. PLEASE NOTE: THE 16MM PRINT OF THIS FILM HAS NORWEGIAN SUBTITLES

results.title: Heathlands
results.brief_description: The first section studies the geology of the dry, sandy heathlands typical of south-eastern England and part of northern France. The second section introduces flora typical of the uncultivated heathlands and the final section deals with the fauna of the heathlands.

results.title: Heather Locklear chocolate
results.brief_description: Award-winning comedy about a gender-bending teenager (Einar Johansen) and his passion for nail polish. Each of his favorites has a story behind it, however his ‘holy grail’ of nail polishes is a colour worn by Heather Locklear in ‘Melrose Place’.

results.title: Heat treatment of aluminum. Part 2
results.brief_description: Explains the nature of cold working operations; crystalline structure of aluminum alloys; slip planes and deformation; microstructure changes during cold working; microstructure changes during annealing; cold working operations; and annealing operations.

results.title: Heat treatment of aluminum. Part 1
results.brief_description: Explains the purpose of heat treatment; micro-structure changes during heat treatment; heat treatment procedure; precipitation hardening; and the effects of heat treatment on the physical properties of aluminum.

results.title: Heat rays
results.brief_description: Instructional film analysing the relationship between heat and light radiation; the sun as a source of light and heat, making a photograph with light and heat rays; applications and uses of heat rays; reflection, refraction and movement of heat rays; applications of these properties of heat rays to everyday life; relationships between heat and light as a form of vibration of electro-magnetic waves of different frequencies; the role of heat rays in maintaining life on this planet.

results.title: Heat causes expansion
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: Shows two children carrying out experiments in their home to prove that solids, liquids and gases expand when heated. Also shows many ways in which this law of physics occurs in everyday life. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gateway Film Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
